steps.title: Take a 1/2" wooden dowel and cut off a 6" segment.
steps.content: Take a 1/2" wooden dowel and cut off a 6" segment.

steps.title: Using a 3/8" drill bit, bore a cavity about 1/10" into one end of the dowel.
steps.content: Using a 3/8" drill bit, bore a cavity about 1/10" into one end of the dowel.

steps.title: Draw a guide line 4 1/2" away from the end with the cavity.
steps.content: Draw a guide line 4 1/2" away from the end with the cavity. This will help you align the paper correctly.

steps.title: Use the pattern to cut a trapezoid out of blank newsprint or packaging paper.
steps.content: Use the pattern to cut a trapezoid out of blank newsprint or packaging paper.

steps.title: Lay paper on a flat surface, with the acute angle pointing forward and left.
steps.content: Lay paper on a flat surface, with the acute angle pointing forward and left. (See picture.)

steps.title: Place the wooden dowel on the paper with the guide line along the right hand side of the paper, about 1/2" from the bottom.
steps.content: Place the wooden dowel on the paper with the guide line along the right hand side of the paper, about 1/2" from the bottom.

steps.title: Roll the paper tightly around the dowel.
steps.content: Roll the paper tightly around the dowel.

steps.title: Leave the dowel in the paper, with the guide line along the right edge of the paper.
steps.content: Leave the dowel in the paper, with the guide line along the right edge of the paper.

steps.title: Twist the excess paper on the left edge tightly.
steps.content: Twist the excess paper on the left edge tightly.

steps.title: Fold the twisted edge onto itself.
steps.content: Fold the twisted edge onto itself. Crush into the hollow left by the wooden dowel by pressing against table.

steps.title: Measure the correct amount of black-powder.
steps.content: Measure the correct amount of black-powder.

steps.title: Pour through the open end of the paper tube.
steps.content: Pour through the open end of the paper tube.

steps.title: Grab the paper directly above the black-powder and twist to make a seal.
steps.content: Grab the paper directly above the black-powder and twist to make a seal. This leaves a paper "tail" above the twisting point.

steps.title: Fold down the paper tail alongside the cartridge.
steps.content: Fold down the paper tail alongside the cartridge. And you're done! Happy shooting!
